Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Boise, stop pouting. I told you that hunting whales was more difficult than it sounded.
You say a lot of things I choose to ignore.
Then maybe you should think about listening to me for a change.
I don't have time to think. I'm too busy planning my next move.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure it works like that, Boise.
Sounds exciting.
I'm not even going to bother asking.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not for you. I must just be better at it than you are.
What isn't exciting about me, Captain?
Good, I wouldn't tell you anyway. At least... not yet.
Well, as long as you don't break the ship we should be good.
Heh. I would never break the ship.
Why are you saying it like that?
Oh, that's the alarm. Time to get the fight started!
I just hope she doesn't shoot someone.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, can I ask a favor?!

Fields.MenuText: Of course, Boise.
That depends on what it is.
You're asking first? That's not like you at all.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap.
It's not like it's anything big, really.
Hey, I'm polite. Sometimes. When I wanna be.
I was just hoping I could get the crew to get something for me the next time we make port?
You don't need to ask my permission to ask people things. You need to ask them.
Oh, sure. I guess that makes sense. Well, I'll go ask them then. See you later, Cap!
Wait a second, what do you want them to pick up for you?
Is that the alarm I hear? We better go fight some Morganas!
I don't hear anything.
*ALARM*
How'd you do that?
See! No time to dilly-dally.
*I'm... sure it'll be fine.*
@BATTLE
Officer, could I ask you something really fast?
Sure, Captain. What do you need?

Fields.MenuText: So what do you think about Boise?
I like doing favors for people. Have you done any favors lately for anyone? Say, I don't know... Boise?
Did Boise tell you about the plan?

Fields.DialogueText: What do I think about her?
Captain, I know what you're getting at. Boise made me swear to secrecy.
Wait, you know about the plan?
*loud cough* Excuse me, you two. We've got Morganas to our west.
Oh, uh, I'll go get ready!
I'll deal with you later.
EEK!
So you're really intent on not letting me find out?
Yes, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm the captain. I will figure it out.
Fine, I can wait. I'm not too worried.
Can't you let me in? It's just little ol' me. *Puppy dog eyes*

Fields.DialogueText: You can try. But by the time you do, it'll already be too late.
You shouldn't be. It's not too bad.
Stop trying to get cute with me. It's not going to work.
Come on, already. I wasn't kidding about those Morganas. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Well, uh, I think she's nice. A little scary sometimes, I guess... Has she said anything about me?
Ummm... What do you mean? Like, what she thinks about you?
Alright, I'm no good at this whole gossip thing. Just tell me what Boise has planned.
Planned? Oh, you mean the--
I'm your captain. I can order you to tell me.
You could, but then she'd be pissed. She's the last person in the world I'd want to make angry. You know what I mean?
Okay, this is ridiculous. Just tell me, I'll deal with Boise.
Fine, just don't tell her I told you. She's going to--
Of course, I'm the captain! I know everything.
I don't think you know this. Boise made it pretty clear she didn't want you hearing about anything.
I already know everything. I'm just making sure you're up to speed.
I'm pretty sure I know more than you. Like the--
Bleh, this food is worse than I remember it being.
Maybe it's time to go fishing again? We could find a nice spot the next time we make port.
Uh, that might not be the best idea.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, you don't want to go fishing with me again?
Scared I'll catch more fish than you this time?
Fine, I guess I'll have to go fishing on my own.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not that. I liked fishing with you. It was pretty fun actually.
If that wasn't so hilarious, I might actually take that challenge seriously.
Sure, either way we won't have any fish.
Why don't you want to go fishing?
I just... have plans for the next time we make port.
You mean your little secret plan?
Suffice it to say, that soon I'll be too busy to complain about the food.
That's not good enough, Boise.
*ALARM*
Oh, what do you know? We've got company. Finish up, Cap, it's time to earn our keep.
@BATTLE
Wow, these are a lot of boxes. What is all of this?
Sorry, Captain. It's everything Boise asked for.

Fields.MenuText: Why do they all have holes?
There's got to be at least two dozen here!
What's in that big one over there?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd have to ask her, Captain.
I think the total is around twenty-nine.
I'm not sure. I just know it was really heavy.
Hey, Cap, sorry about all this extra stuff. I'm sure I can make room for it.
Now that you've got them on my ship are you going to let me in on this plan of yours? Or do I have to crack one of these open myself?
I would not do that if I were you!
Captain, there are Morganas headed this way. They seem to have their eyes on the city.
One more reason not to open any boxes. No reason to distract the crew during battle.
... We're going to talk about this later, Boise.
Fine, but for now, we have a bunch of Morganas to drive away!
You heard her!
@BATTLE
Excuse me, do you know where all those boxes ended up? I've been looking for a while and haven't been able to find them.
Oh, you mean all the crates Boise asked for?
Exactly.
I'm pretty sure she moved them away from the storage room on her own. Just so you wouldn't find them.
Always one step ahead of me. Thanks anyway.
Wait, I'm pretty sure I saw where she hid them.

Fields.MenuText: Really? Where?
Well, spit it out, Officer!
That sounds a little too convenient. Is this a trap or something?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't really remember, but I think I can draw you a map.
I would, but... It'd be easier to draw you a map or show you.
No, of course not. I, uh... I'll draw you a map.
Wait, why can't you just tell me?
I don't really remember. I might've been a little inebriated. I'm going to need to retrace my steps.
Fine, just get your map to me soon. Right now, I just hope you're not too hung over to fight a few Morganas.
@BATTLE
This is definitely the room.
At least... I think it is. I better remind myself not to let the cartographer get drunk. We'd never get anywhere!
No Boise in sight. I'll just step in and figure out what's going on.
It's kind of dark in there. I can hardly see anything... Yeah those are the boxes. I'm going to need a light though. I'll be right back.
There you are, Captain! Why are you hiding down here? No one knew where to find you.

Fields.MenuText: Uh... nothing...
I was looking for you. Some of the crew pointed me in this direction.
I dropped a penny. Have you seen it anywhere?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Uh huh, sure.
Well, here I am. What did you need?
A penny? Seriously? Do you think I'm stupid?
... uh... Why were you looking for me?
We've got Morganas headed for us. Figured you should know before I blow them out of the water.
Well, let's do it then.
I wasn't asking permission!
@BATTLE
Here's my flashlight. Now I should be able to see down there.
Hey, Captain. Wha-- hey, what's that?
It's my flashlight.
Oh, fancy-schmancy. What, is somebody too good for a lantern?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. This is so much easier than fire light.
You still prefer lanterns?
There's nothing fancy about them. Everyone's using them these days.

Fields.DialogueText: Easier isn't always better.
Yeah, it's way more useful. Plus, fire is comforting.
Well, I don't use them.
Well, you're a Belle. I guess things are different for you.
That sounded insulting.
You know I'd never insult you. I like you way too much.
*Blush* Wha---but---shut up!
That's the alarm. Time to fight some Morganas.
Where do you think I'm going?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I can see perfectly now. There are even more boxes than I remember. I can barely see through this hole, but let's see if can see what's inside?

Fields.MenuText: (Look through one hole while shining the light in another.)
(Just pry it open already.)
(Maybe I should give it up.)

Fields.DialogueText: I think I can see now. Wait... is that an eye? Whoa! I saw something move!
Okay, enough with this. Where's that crowbar! Yikes! Is this box making sounds?
It might be time to head back. A Morgana could attack any moment now
*ANIMALS*
Why is the ship rocking so much!? Ahhh!
*CRACK*
*ALARM*
What are these? Squirrels? I gotta get to the deck, we've got Morganas.
@BATTLE
They're crawling all over the ship!
Ignore them, we can't allow any distractions in the middle of battle.
Grrrrrr. Captain, what did you do?
Don't growl at me. Growl at the Morganas!
The ship is overrun with animals, Captain!
How did they all get out?
We're working under the assumption that the squirrels worked together to free the bigger animals. There are teeth marks on the crates to support this theory.
You just had to go snooping! Are you happy now?

Fields.MenuText: It's not my fault. The squirrels did it!
I know. I'm sorry. You're right, it's my fault.
What are you mad about? Isn't this what you wanted?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the oldest line in the book.
Well, I'm glad you can at least man up about it.
I didn't want to turn the ship into a zoo! I wanted to hunt one crate at a time safely. Hardly anyone would have noticed.
So what's our next move? I'm asking you, the expert hunter here.
Now, you're going to let me handle it.
... Okay. We'll follow your lead here.
Hehe, does that make me the captain now?
Don't push it.
Captain, we've got Morganas to the south.
Looks like we'll have to deal with the animals later.
Maybe they'll help us fight the Morganas.
Wouldn't that be something.
@BATTLE
How's the hunt going, Boise?
Eh, it could be going better.
Are you kidding? Captain, I saw Boise capture a couple dozen squirrels with just a single acorn. I'd never seen anything like it!
He's full of it. I had two acorns.

Fields.MenuText: Whoa, Boise, I'm impressed.
That's great and all, but I'm more concerned with the bigger animals on board.
So, what's next? We've still got more animals than crew on this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: You ain't seen nothing yet.
You'd be surprised how much havoc a few squirrels can cause.
Patience. I'm just getting started.
Great, the alarm.
Oh, sounds fun. I could go for some real battle right about now.
Do you think it would be too cruel to launch a crate full of squirrels at the Morganas?
Seeing as how they would probably die on impact? Yes.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, I have good news and bad news. Which do you want first?

Fields.MenuText: Give me something good.
Might as well hear the bad first.
Surprise me.

Fields.DialogueText: So I was able to take down a couple of deer, so we're going to have venison for a few days.
So... I guess someone accidentally picked up an elephant. But, it's just a young one, so it shouldn't destroy the ship or anything.
Well a few deer were causing some havoc below deck, but I was able to take them down before they did too much damage.
Great... an elephant. You can kill it, right?
I could, but I won't. I'm a hunter, not a poacher.
I think I know what you mean. There are some lines you won't cross, right?
Yeah, exactly. Poachers hunt and kill anything for profit. There are things I won't kill unless I have to.
Like baby elephants.
Exactly.
I'm glad to hear it, actually. I was a little worried the ship would be covered in the blood of woodland creatures by the end of this.
Nope. Just a little deer blood in the boiler room. It'll come right out.
But we can work on cleaning that after we take care of this alarm.
@BATTLE
I do like venison. What's the bad news?
You weren't wrong about seeing an elephant. I guess someone accidentally picked up a young one.
What's the good news?
That was the good news. The bad news is... There's a little elephant running around the ship.
Seriously? So, I did see an elephant? What's the good news?
Venison burgers!
*ALARM*
It's still crazy below deck. It's a complete mess.
What! There are bats! Why are there bats?
I'm working on it!

Fields.MenuText: Get it out of my hair, Boise!
Eeeeek, save me!
Is it gone?

Fields.DialogueText: It's already gone.
Sheesh, calm down. It's long gone.
Yeah, you're good.
*clears throat* So having some trouble with these bats?
A little. I can't get them to stay still. They've gotta be nesting somewhere. I just can't find them.
Nesting? That's a scary thought.
It has to be somewhere nice and dark...
Maybe the room you were keeping them in? It was pretty dark.
That's a good idea, actually. I haven't even looked there. I figured they'd all run for freedom.
Well, you can look after we deal with a few Morganas.
Yeah, yeah, bring ‘em on!
@BATTLE
So, Boise, what are you hunting now?
Actually, I was just about to decide between the ferrets and the bobcats.

Fields.MenuText: Go for the ferrets. The little rodents are everywhere.
I'd say bobcats. They've been scaring the crew lately.
What?! I haven't seen either of those anywhere!

Fields.DialogueText: Ferrets, here I come. Thanks for the help deciding.
Bobcats it is. Thanks for helping me decide.
They're everywhere. You clearly haven't been paying attention.
Well if you need me, I'll be on the hunt.
Have fun, I'm sure you've got this completely handled.
Maybe not completely, but it's more fun that way.
Cute. Think you can handle a few Morganas though?
Pft, even with both hands tied behind my back.
If you keep saying stuff like that, I may just decide to test out that theory one day.
Hehehe, bring it on! Sounds like fun!
@BATTLE
Boise, I've been wondering for a while. Where are you putting all these animals after you catch them?
Well, when I can catch them I've been putting most of them in my quarters.
In your quarters?
Yeah, there's plenty of space.

Fields.MenuText: So, there are squirrels roaming freely around your room now?
So, you have a bunch of bats roosting above your bed right now?
So the elephant is just cuddling in your bed?

Fields.DialogueText: No, of course not. We unloaded them a while ago.
No, we released them. They wanted out. They just couldn't find the exit.
... Maybe... He's super cuddly.
Anything I put in my room is just there while we're at sea. When we make landfall, I let them off the ship.
I see... That should be fine. As long as you're not keeping those ferrets and bobcats in there at the same time.
... Of course not... I'll be right back.
That could be bad.
Captain, we've got Morganas. Where is Boise going?
She's just got to deal with something. She'll be ready for the fight.
@BATTLE
Boise, I'm going to need a timetable here.
Is that like a table with a clock in it? That sounds kind of cool.
How much longer is this going to take you?
I'm already done thinking about the clock table. It'd be too hard to eat on it with the second hand always ticking away.
I mean the animals.
Oh! I'm not sure. Maybe a week. At most a month.
That's longer than I was expecting.
Well, if I move any faster I could miss some.

Fields.MenuText: I understand, but I've got an idea.
Sounds like you have your hands full.
... You'd put the clock in the table with a layer of glass on top.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm open to suggestions.
Maybe a little, but I can do anything, Captain. I've got this.
You're still thinking about that? We've moved on, Cap.
Captain, we--
Morganas?
Yeah.
I'm locked and loaded, Cap.
Let's get this done quick so we can get back to what's important.
Um, aren't Morganas important?
Yeah, yeah.
@BATTLE
Alright, Boise, I'm ready.
Ready? Wait, what are you doing with that gun? And... is that a bow?
Yes, I tried to prepare for any circumstance. I've also got a survival knife and a pouch of bait.
You're... planning to hunt? Like that? Do you even know how to shoot an arrow with that thing?

Fields.MenuText: I'll have you know I'm an excellent archer. I've been shooting for years.
I'm a quick learner. And I'm sure you'll be a terrific archery teacher.
It's really more for appearances. That's why I also brought the gun. I can shoot a gun.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, really? You should've told me sooner. It would've been fun to have a few archery contests.
Well, obviously I'd be an excellent teacher. And with a few lessons from me you'll be better with a bow than you are with a gun.
Yes, and the entire ship can hear a gun. You might put down one deer, but the rest of the animals on board will start to run and hide.
... You'll need to follow my lead and listen to me at every point. That's the only way this will work.
So that means I can help?
I don't know yet. But you can come along, and I'll try to keep you from making things worse.
Thanks for the vote of confidence.
Anytime, Captain. Now, how about we take that confidence and fight some Morganas?
Do I still have to follow your lead?
You don't have to. But you probably should.
@BATTLE
So what are we hunting, again?
I already told you. A bear found the kitchen and started getting into all our food. If we don't take him down he'll leave us without anything to eat.
That's right. What do you want me to do?
What do you want to do? What do you think the best strategy for the situation is?

Fields.MenuText: I could jump in there and try to be a distraction.
I can stay back and take a shot if he gets too close to you.
... Do we have dynamite?

Fields.DialogueText: And get mauled to death by a bear? Too painful. I like you too much to let you die like that.
That's probably the safest way to deal with this. For you at least.
We're not using explosives on our own ship! Let's not do the Morganas' work for them. I would've thought you were smarter than that.
I'm going in. Watch my back, and stay quiet.
Alright, everything's looking good so far. She's staying low, getting close to him. Why is she getting so close? Wow she's getting ballsy!
*ALARM*
Crap! That was the worst time for the alarm to go off! It spotted her!
I'll take you down!

Fields.MenuText: (Shoot it)
(Wait and see)

Fields.DialogueText: Why'd you do that? I had it under control!
Dodge this, bear!
Now let's go take on some Morganas!
@BATTLE
The alarm went off. I didn't want you getting hurt.
Well... thanks, I guess, but next time don't worry so much. Please.
What? She just jumped on top of it! She's riding it like some kind of fat horse.
And he's down. I don't even know how she did it, but I'm impressed.
How'd that look? Pretty neat, right?
You like me?
Keep your eye on the prize, Cap. And, try not to die.
Hey, you keep telling me to have faith in you. I'm sure you can handle one little bear.
You have a point. I can definitely take him on my own.
I'm not thinking about the Morganas. Right now the bear is our main concern.
We're not using dynamite. Scaredy-Cap.
Okay, so I found a few wolves hiding down here a while ago. They seem mostly scared, so let's try to capture them instead of killing them.
Is there a reason none of them have attacked the crew yet?
I don't know. The ocean's probably freaking them out or something.
I guess even wolves get sea sickness.
So, they shouldn't be too hard to knock out.
Is that what this meat is for?
Yes, it's drugged. It should knock them out and give us enough time to put them in a crate.

Fields.MenuText: They're wolves. Why don't we just kill them? They'd do the same to us if they had the chance.
Sounds like a plan, I'm guessing I have your back again?
I feel like I need to ask how you got drugged meat.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't kill for no good reason. They're not attacking us right now, and I don't think anyone on board is interested in eating wolf meat.
You are learning. Good, Captain.
Well you take drugs, and then you take meat, and then you put them together.
Now, just keep your distance and let me handle this.
There she goes. There's the meat. They're noticing it, and yikes, it's practically gone already.
That was easier than I expected! They must've been hungry.
You sure they're out?
Yeah, I'm pretty darn sure. Just drag the boxes over here. Make it fast! I'm worried that alarm could wake them up any second.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Okay, I think it's about time we practice on your archery. That way you can be a little more helpful out there.

Fields.MenuText: Are you saying you don't want my help anymore?
You have a pretty low opinion of me. I think I might surprise you.
I still don't see why I can't just use my pistol. It's much easier.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I do, maybe I don't. If nothing else, I like the company.
This would be a hell of a time to start now.
I like pistols as much as the next guy, but they're just way too loud in this case.
... So, I'm just going to aim for that board you stood up over there?
Exactly, but remember to account for the wind, the distance, and the rocking of the ship.
I got it, I got it!
Ow!
Oh no!
That's not getting it! He was miles away, Captain!
My leg!
Boise, help me get him to the infirmary!
Right, let's hurry.
Oh really? I thought you were the lone wolf type.
Shut up... Just let me set up your target.
Yeah, yeah, I see your point.
Good, now let me see you take a few shots with that bow.
I can be surprising! Just point out my target and I'll show you a bullseye.
Alright, I'll set up your target so you can start impressing me.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I think I should maybe handle the rest of the animals on my own.
Is this about the arrow incident?
Maybe a little bit.

Fields.MenuText: It was a onetime thing. I'm good, seriously!
I understand, I won't touch a bow again.
Maybe I just need a little more practice.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure you are, but I'd rather you cheer me on than accidentally shoot me in the back.
Well, you can touch a bow, just wait until I teach you a little more first.
And I'd be happy to help you with that once the ship is clear, okay?
I understand.
Thanks... I just want you to know I'm glad you wanted to help me. It means a lot.
Of course I wanted to help. It's partly my fault the ship got overrun in the first place.
Is that the only reason?
What do you mean?
We've got Morganas, Captain! Oh, was I interrupting something?
No! Let's just shoot up some ugly Morgana ships!
@BATTLE
We're looking good, Boise. I haven't seen an animal on board in a while.
Well, you're clearly not looking hard enough. There are still plenty roaming around the ship.
Like what?
Well, we've got porcupines under the bow, a few anteaters are hanging out near the engines, and I'm pretty sure I saw a monkey around the barracks.

Fields.MenuText: We have porcupines?
Anteaters? Does that mean we have ants?
I've always wanted a pet monkey.

Fields.DialogueText: The Porcupines are the least of our worries. Just don't try to touch them, they don't like that.
Anteaters don't just eat ants. They could be eating termites or grubs too. Whatever we have, I'm sure they'll take care of them.
You don't want this one. It's got a chip on its shoulder or something. I saw it flinging poo everywhere.
I've noticed that a lot of these animals aren't exactly normal things people hunt.
Well, it wouldn't be any fun to just hunt a bunch of deer, or hogs, or something. I wanted to try out some exotic stuff.
Because obviously hunting in the middle of the ocean isn't enough of a challenge for you.
You know me so well.
I'm guessing Morganas aren't much of a challenge for you either?
So far? Nope.
@BATTLE
Hey... I'm really glad to see you're doing better. And you're not limping! That's a good sign.
Yeah, apparently it wasn't as bad as it felt. In a week or so, I should be off the pain meds.
Really sorry about that. I can't say it enough.
It's really fine. Don't worry about it, I'm not holding it against you or anything.
Next time I'll make sure to clear the deck before giving the Captain an arrow.

Fields.MenuText: That... might not be the worst idea.
Or we could just practice somewhere private. Like my room.
Seriously, I know how to shoot a bow and arrow!

Fields.DialogueText: I have the best ideas, Captain.
Captain... I feel like you might be implying something there.
Clearly. Just not at the target.
Is that just a ringing in my head from the drugs or is that the alarm?
Nope, that's the alarm.
Phew, I was worried there for a second.
You should still be worried, we're about to fight Morganas.
Yeah, but I'm here. So no need to worry.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Boise, are you in there?
Just a second!
What's all that noise in there? What are you doing?
Oh, hey, Captain, what's going on?
I just wanted to check in. Are all the animals gone? I haven't gotten a report, but it seems pretty clear.
Yeah, it's clear. I thought I told you. I just caught the last of the anteaters. We've now officially got a human crew again.
Mostly.
Hmmmm?
I know you're hiding something in there.
... It's just one. Please, can't I keep him?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, you can keep him. As long as you take care of him.
I'm not sure...
What is it? A wolf, a bobcat?

Fields.DialogueText: I promise! Thank you, so much, Captain!
Please, I'll take care of him and everything!
It's the elephant...
You're the best captain ever!
I could spend all day listening to you compliment me, but it seems like we have some Morganas to contend with.
Then let's deal with them!
*ELEPHANT TRUMPET*
I hope I don't regret this...
@BATTLE
Okay, fine, but only because you're giving me those puppy dog eyes.
Seriously...? I don't know why I'm saying this, but fine. But, when he gets too big, we're going to have this conversation again.
Whoa, you're squeezing me a little tight, Boise. It's getting a little hard to breathe.
Hey, Boise. You know it's polite to knock first?
Shut up. I have something that I need to say, and I wanted to say it in private.
Okay, it sounds serious.

Fields.MenuText: Is everything all right?
Whatever it is, you can trust me.
Take a seat. What's on your mind?

Fields.DialogueText: Talking about feelings does not come naturally to me.
Oh, Captain, I know that I can, and I do trust you in all things.
I have been thinking about this for sometime now...
I... okay. What does this mean?
Nothing. Absolutely nothing. I lost a bet is all.
Yeah? With who?
It's unimportant.
*ALARM*
We don't have a lot of time. Are you going to tell me?
They know the perfect time to show up, don't they? Let's go.
Wait, Boise...
Hmm?
I just want you to know...
If you ever want to explain what this non-conversation was really about, I'd... be interested to hear it.
Unless it was your way of softening me up for a second elephant.
Ha. Someday, Cap. I promise.
... The explaining or the second elephant?
Seriously. We have a one elephant limit!
You have me a little concerned.
Please, don't be.
